info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 12:23PM MST until April 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
MST Fri Apr 11 2025/
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ SATURDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY IN NAVAJO AND APACHE COUNTIES AND THE WHITE MOUNTAINS...
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ SUNDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY IN NAVAJO AND APACHE COUNTIES AND THE WHITE MOUNTAINS...
The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Saturday. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Sunday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Alpine, Eagar-Springerville, Holbrook, Pinetop-Lakeside, Saint Johns, Show Low, Snowflake- Taylor, Whiteriver and Winslow. This includes portions of the Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest.
* WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent.
* IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; White Mountains
